org.cougaar.core.service
Class BlackboardService.Delegate

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.core.service.BlackboardService.Delegate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service, BlackboardService
Enclosing interface:
BlackboardService
public static class BlackboardService.Delegate
extends java.lang.Object
implements BlackboardService

BlackboardService.Delegate is an instantiable convenience class which may be used by Binder writers to bind BlackboardService, either as a simple protective indirection layer, or as the base class for more complex behavior. This implementation merely passes through all requests to a constructor specified delegate.

public Subscriber getSubscriber()
Specified by:
getSubscriber in interface BlackboardService

subscribe

public <T> IncrementalSubscription<T> subscribe(UnaryPredicate<T> isMember)
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Request a subscription to all objects for which isMember.execute(object) is true. The returned Collection is a transactionally-safe set of these objects which is guaranteed not to change out from under you during run() execution. subscribe() may be called any time after load() completes.

Specified by:
subscribe in interface BlackboardService

                                                java.util.Collection<T> realCollection)
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
like subscribe(UnaryPredicate), but allows specification of some other type of Collection object as the internal representation of the collection. Alias for getSubscriber().subscribe(UnaryPredicate, Collection);

subscribe

public <T> Subscription<T> subscribe(UnaryPredicate<T> isMember,
                                     java.util.Collection<T> realCollection,
                                     boolean isIncremental)
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Alias for getSubscriber().subscribe(UnaryPredicate, Collection, boolean);

Specified by:
subscribe in interface BlackboardService
Parameters:
isMember - a predicate to execute to ascertain membership in the collection of the subscription.
realCollection - a container to hold the contents of the subscription.
isIncremental - should be true if an incremental subscription is desired. An incremental subscription provides access to the incremental changes to the subscription.
Returns:
the Subsciption.

query

public <T> java.util.Collection<T> query(UnaryPredicate<T> isMember)
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Issue a query against the logplan. Similar in function to opening a new subscription, getting the results and immediately closing the subscription, but can be implemented much more efficiently. Note: the initial implementation actually does exactly this.

Specified by:
query in interface BlackboardService

publishChange

public void publishChange(java.lang.Object o)
Specified by:
publishChange in interface BlackboardService

publishChange

public void publishChange(java.lang.Object o,
                          java.util.Collection<? extends ChangeReport> changes)
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
mark an element of the Plan as changed. Behavior is not defined if the object is not a member of the plan. There is no need to call this if the object was added or removed, only if the contents of the object itself has been changed. The changes parameter describes a set of changes made to the object beyond those tracked automatically by the object class (see the object class documentation for a description of which types of changes are tracked). Any additional changes are merged in after automatically collected reports.

Specified by:
publishChange in interface BlackboardService
changes - a set of ChangeReport instances or null.

openTransaction

public void openTransaction()
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Open a transaction by grabbing the transaction lock and updating the subscriptions. This method blocks waiting for the transaction lock.

Specified by:
openTransaction in interface BlackboardService

tryOpenTransaction

public boolean tryOpenTransaction()
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Attempt to open a transaction by attempting to grab the transaction lock and updating the collections (iff we got the lock). This is equivalent to the old (misnamed) tryLockSubscriber method in PluginWrapper.

Specified by:
tryOpenTransaction in interface BlackboardService
Returns:
true IFF a transaction was opened.

closeTransaction

public void closeTransaction()
                      throws SubscriberException
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Close a transaction opened by openTransaction() or a successful tryOpenTransaction(), flushing the change tracking (delta) lists of any open subscriptions.

Specified by:
closeTransaction in interface BlackboardService
Throws:
SubscriberException - IFF we did not own the transaction lock.

closeTransactionDontReset

public void closeTransactionDontReset()
                               throws SubscriberException
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Close a transaction opened by openTransaction() or a successful tryOpenTransaction(), but don't reset subscription changes or clear delta lists. In effect, defers changes tracked until next transaction.

Specified by:
closeTransactionDontReset in interface BlackboardService
Throws:
SubscriberException - IFF we did not own the transaction lock.

closeTransaction

public void closeTransaction(boolean resetp)
                      throws SubscriberException
Deprecated. Use closeTransactionDontReset

Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Close a transaction opened by openTransaction() or a successful tryOpenTransaction().

Specified by:
closeTransaction in interface BlackboardService
Parameters:
resetp - IFF true, all subscriptions will have their resetChanges() method called to clear any delta lists, etc.
Throws:
SubscriberException - IFF we did not own the transaction lock.

isTransactionOpen

public boolean isTransactionOpen()
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Check to see if a transaction is open and owned by the current thread. There is no method to check to see if the subscribe has a transaction open which is owned by a different thread, since that would not be a safe operation.

Specified by:
isTransactionOpen in interface BlackboardService
Returns:
true IFF the current thread already has an open transaction.

signalClientActivity

public void signalClientActivity()
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
called when the client (Plugin) requests that it be waked again. by default, just calls wakeSubscriptionWatchers, but subclasses may be more circumspect.

Specified by:
signalClientActivity in interface BlackboardService

persistNow

public void persistNow()
                throws PersistenceNotEnabledException
Description copied from interface: BlackboardService
Take a persistence snapshot now. If called from inside a transaction (the usual case for a plugin), the transaction will be closed and reopened. This means that a plugin must first process all of its existing envelopes before calling persistNow() and then process a potential new set of envelopes after re-opening the transaction. Otherwise, the changes will be lost.

Specified by:
persistNow in interface BlackboardService
Throws:
PersistenceNotEnabledException
